ref: 12270 *śaṭṭa ʻ defective ʼ. 2. śaṭha -- (and *śaḍa -- ) ʻ deceitful ʼ Āpast., ʻ cheat, fool, idler ʼ W. 3. śaṇṭhá -- 1 m. ʻ rogue, fool ʼ lex., ʻ impotent ʼ Uṇādis. 4. *śaṇṭhara -- . 5. ṣaṇḍhá -- , v.ll. śa˚, sa˚, ṣaṇḍa -- 3, śa˚ m. ʻ eunuch ʼ Gr̥Śr., ˚aka -- m. MBh., ṣaṇḍhī -- f. ʻ woman without menstrual periods or breasts ʼ. [Poss. connexions in Mu. PMWS 80. -- In words containing a sibillant it is impossible to determine whether the NIA. forms with unaspirated retroflex represent an original aspirate or not: the aspirate and unaspirated forms are therefore grouped together, although the presumption from similar ʻ defective ʼ word -- groups is that the two series existed in this group also. -- Cf. the group *śuḍa -- (śuṇṭhá -- , *śuṇḍha -- , *śūḍha -- 2, *śōṭṭha -- 1, *śōṭha -- 1, *śōṇṭha -- , *śōruṇḍa -- , śōla -- ) and similar groups s.vv. kuṇṭha -- , *ṭuṇṭa -- 2, *naṭṭa -- , baṇḍá -- , *bukka -- 4, *maṭṭa -- , *rakka -- , *lakka -- 1, vaṇṭa -- 2. -- Cf. *śaṇṭha -- 2 ʻ lump ʼ]
K. haṭun ʻ to become lean ʼ, hüṭü f. ʻ that which has become thin, stick, (at end of cmpds.) dried up ʼ.
